abstract_summ: At present, there is no reliable risk stratification tool for non-severe COVID-19 patients at admission . We aimed to construct an effective model for early identifying cases at high risk of progression to severe . We found one demographic and six serological indicators (age, serum lactate dehydrogenase, C-reactive protein, the coefficient of variation of red blood cell distribution width (RDW), blood urea nitrogen, albumin, direct bilirubin) are associated with severe .
